data.text: @cheweydelt @mattyglesias Do you have any proof this actually increased as an anti covid measure other than your personal experience

@mattyglesias @conor64 This wasn’t an anti covid measure. This was happening before Covid. But I understand the narrative you’re pushing now is that every bad thing society does is a result of covid mitigation efforts
@mattyglesias California now requires that you request utensils with take out or you're going without.
@mattyglesias While insisting we all use paper straws . . .
@irongarlic @mattyglesias Yes, because clearly the restaurant owners don't know what is good for their business and they are looking for advice on Twitter about how to save money.

@Stoke0Newington @mattyglesias If there is a critical level of microscopic plastic in the oceans that triggers massive plant/animal death, I am concerned what that would mean for humans.  Could we survive dead oceans?
@mattyglesias And stop giving them out altogether, unless requested.

@hyperplanes @mattyglesias Wonder what the material ratio is between plastic in the wrapper vs. fork? These don't get thrown out when I drop them, or find them sitting on the counter next to the bucket of forks.
@johanlenox @mattyglesias It was a thing before but mostly utensils were loose now it's almost universally individually packaged.
